type.en: Course with defence at the end

description.en: Master's thesis supports professional development of the student, while it provides them with opportunities to link acquired knowledge with practical work, to develop and test innovative educational technology solution that has practical relevance. The master's thesis will be done usually in a small group. It means that the research problem will be identified and defined in collaboration, the tasks will be divided, the solutions will be developed and tested at the workplaces of the group members, data analysis and conclusions will be made by the group. The thesis will be defended in a group but the contribution of every group member will be presented clearly and the collaboration skills of the group members will be evaluated.
description.et: Magistritöö toetab üliõpilase professionaalset arengut, luues grupis võimalusi seostada õpitu praktilise tööga, töötades välja ja testides innovaatilist praktilise väärtusega haridustehnoloogilist lahendust. Magistritöö tehakse üldjuhul väikses grupis. See tähendab ühist uurimisprobleemi sõnastamist ja määratlemist, tööülesannete jagamist, lahenduste ühist väljatöötamist ja testimist gruppi kuuluvate inimeste töökohtadel, ühist andmeanalüüsi ja järelduste tegemist. Töö kaitstakse ühiselt ja seejuures tuuakse välja iga rühmaliikme panus ning hinnatakse rühmaliikmete koostööoskusi.

objectives.en: The master's thesis guides students to develop practical solutions to educational technology problems, to test and study them, to draw conclusions and, in doing all this, in collaboration with others. In addition, the students learn how to present and defend their work in written and oral format.
objectives.et: Magistritöö eesmärk on suunata üliõpilast haridustehnoloogilisele probleemile praktiliste lahenduste väljatöötamisele, nende lahenduste testimisele ja uurimisele ning järelduste tegemisele ja seda kõike koostöös teistega. Lisaks sellele õpivad tudengid oma tööd esitama ning kaitsma kirjalikult ja suuliselt.

learning_outcomes.en: After defending the work, the student:
(1)	is able to apply acquired knowledge in formulating educational technology research problems and in planning and executing related development work and studies;
learning_outcomes.et: (1)	oskab rakendada omandatud teadmisi haridustehnoloogiliste probleemide sõnastamisel ja vastavate arendustööde ning uuringute planeerimisel ja läbiviimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: (2)	is able to find and critically analyse domain-specific literature and relate it with his/her practical project and study;
learning_outcomes.et: (2)	oskab leida ja analüüsida erialast infot ning seostada oma praktilise projekti ja uurimusega;

learning_outcomes.en: (3)	has skills to present his/her thoughts clearly, to discuss with opponents and to defend his/her positions;
learning_outcomes.et: (3)	oskab oma mõtteid arusaadavalt esitada, oponentidega diskuteerida ja oma argumenteeritud seisukohti kaitsta;

learning_outcomes.en: (4)	is able to work in a group;
(5)	can adequately evaluate outcomes of his/her work and sees opportunities for continuing learning.
learning_outcomes.et: (5)	oskab adekvaatselt hinnata oma töö tulemusi ja näha võimalusi jätkuõppeks.

independent_work.et:
1.	Planning and executing the study, writing the thesis and preparing the presentation.
2.	Reflection of the process of the study.
3.	Evaluation of peers' collaboration skills.

Guidelines are given in Moodle.

description.et: The students of every peer group fill in a questionnaire for evaluating collaboration skills of their peers, these will be also evaluated by the mentors of the groups. Students' and mentors' evaluation are combined (30/70) in the final score. The criteria will be specified in the questionnaire.

The defence committee evaluates the thesis in the following aspects:
1)	clarity and relevance of the research problem or aims of the development work (15%),
2)	quality of the literature review (20%),
3)	design of the study (15%),
4)	relevance of data collection and analysis methods and quality of their application (20%),
5)	clarity and relevance of the main conclusions (15%),
6)	use of scientific language and accordance with formatting rules (15%)

The defence committee evaluates the presentation in the following aspects:
1)	quality of presentation, focus on the main aspects (30%),
2)	quality of oral communication and defence (20%),
3)	answers to the questions (30%),
4)	technical quality of the presentation, timing (20%)

grade_preconditions.et:
The reports, feedback and evaluations have to be submitted.
The students have to participate in the online discussions of the group.

grade_evaluation.et:
Assessment is based on evaluation of collaboration skills (10%), thesis (70%), and presentation (20%). The scores of them will be summed. The final score is:
A - 91-100% of maximum score
B - 81-90% of maximum score
C - 71-80% of maximum score
D - 61-70% of maximum score
E - 51-60% of maximum score
F (failed) - 50% or of the maximum score or at least one of the criteria is assessed 50% or less from the maximum.

debt_elimination.et: According to the rules set in university's study regulations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
